Ignore the copyright notice at the bottom of this page! Everything else on this site is copyrighted by the people who worked hard to create it. But this is just a list. Use it however you wish.

Novels | Collections | Short Fiction | Non-Fiction (Selected)

Bones of the Earth,

NY: Eos Books, 2002.

Griffin's Egg,

London: Century Legend, 1991;

NY: St. Martin's Press, 1992.

In The Drift,

NY: Ace Books, 1985,

London: Century Legend, 1989.

London: Millenium, 1993;

NY: Morrow, 1994;

NY: Avonova, 1995.

NY: Avon Books, 1997;

NY: Arbor House, 1987;

NY: Ace Books, 1988;

London: Simon & Schuster, Ltd., 1988;

Novels | Collections | Short Fiction | Non-Fiction (Selected)

Cigar-Box Faust, San Francisco: Tachyon Publications, 2001.

Contains:

"Cigar-Box Faust",

"Writing In My Sleep",

"An Abecedary of the Imagination",

"Eight Takes On Kindred Themes",

"Picasso Deconstructed: Eleven Still-Lifes",

"Brief Essays",

"Archaic Planets",

"The Mask" (shorter version), and

"The Madness of Gordon Van Gelder".

A Geography Of Unknown Lands, Lemoyne, PA: Tiger Eyes Press, 1997.

Contains:

"The Wireless Folly",

"Mother Grasshopper",

"North of Diddy-Wah-Diddy",

"The Edge of the World",

"Radio Waves",

"The Changelings Tale".

Gravity's Angels, Sauk City: Arkham House, 1991;

Berkeley: Frog Ltd., 2001.

Contains:

"A Midwinters Tale",

"The Feast of St. Janis",

"The Blind Minotaur",

"The Transmigration of Philip K",

"Covenant of Souls",

"The Dragon Line",

"Mummer Kiss",

"Trojan Horse",

"Snow Angels",

"The Man Who Met Picasso",

"Foresight",

"Ginungagap",

"The Edge of the World".

Moon Dogs, Ann A. Broomhead and Timothy P. Szczesuil, eds., Framingham, MA: NESFA Press, 2000.

Contains:

"Author Profile",

"Moon Dogs",

"The Death of the Magus: Two Myths",

"Mickelrede",

"Vergil Magus: King Without Country",

"Jane Swanwick and the Search for Identity",

"The Hagiography of Saint Dozois",

"Ancestral Voices",

"The City of God",

"The Dead" (dramatic version),

"They Fell Like Wheat",

"A Users Guide To the Postmoderns",

"Ships",

"In the Tradition",

"Growing Up in the Future", and

Griffins Egg.

Puck Aleshire's Abecedary, Pleasantville, NY: Dragon Press, 2000.

Contains:

"Puck Aleshires Abecedary"

Tales Of Old Earth, Berkley, CA: Frog Ltd., 2000.

Contains:

"The Very Pulse of the Machine",

"The Dead",

"Scherzo With Tyrannosaur",

"Ancient Engines",

"North of Diddy-Wah-Diddy",

"The Mask",

"Mother Grasshopper",

"Riding the Giganotosaur",

"Wild Minds",

"The Raggle Taggle Gypsy-O",

"Microcosmic Dog",

"In Concert",

"Radiant Doors",

"Ice Age",

"Walking Out",

"The Changelings Tale",

"Midnight Express",

"The Wisdom of Old Earth",

"Radio Waves".

Omni, Vol. 7: No. 6, March, 1985.

"Golden Apples of the Sun", see "Virgin Territory".

Isaac Asimovs Science Fiction Magazine, Vol. 16: No. 10, September, 1992.

"Inconsequence and Moonlight".

Unpublished.

"The Mask", short-short story.

"Picasso Deconstructed: Eleven Still-Lifes",
